revised_title: Understanding the Physiology of the Human Voice
tldr: John Bishop's research explores the physiology of the human voice, focusing on the vibrations of the glottis and the role of the vocal ligaments and air pressure. He explains how the vocal tube adjusts to vibrate with the glottis, and how the larynx's position affects the pitch. Falsetto tones are produced by nodal divisions in the air column and vocal tube. The paper includes several illustrations.
